readingMnemonic: Oddly, this is the one word that uses the on'yomi reading, which you didn't learn with the kanji. To remember this particular <vocabulary>swamp</vocabulary>, note how there are two kanji in here that make this area particularly swampy. Because it's the swampiest, boggiest place in all of Japan, of course the <reading>Sho</reading>gun (しょう) wants it for himself. Even though it's useless land, he wants the best of everything, being the Shogun and all.
